Name: ITP - Foam Bitumen Stabilisation - Pre Treatments Rev C
Prompting Name: ITP - Foam Bitumen Stabilisation - Pre Treatments

Name: Detail of Activity / Test - Install offset pegs / check geometric model; record centreline, edge line or mark out stabilisation extents from existing line marking
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Prior to each section
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Electronic survey files
Detail of Activity / Test - Pre-hoe to depth specified and shape as instructed in the site spcific methodology statement and/or IFC drawings and proof roll while compacting
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Prior to stabilisation per section
Inspection / Test method - Use grader's machine control and inspect shape
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - N/A

Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Intention is to carry out only minor correction (eg.2% to 3%). Any major shape corrections to be identified prior to site establishment and included in the site specific methodology statement
Detail of Activity / Test - Pre-hoe to depth specified and shape as instructed in the site spcific methodology statement and/or IFC drawings and proof roll while compacting
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Prior to stabilisation per section
Inspection / Test method - Visual check or Vibratory Roller's response meter
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Stabilising Contractor confirm no obvious soft areas found
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Any soft spots identified by visual means or that show up as significantly different to be raised with the ER for further instructions
Detail of Activity / Test - Plateau Density Test
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - On first day per site and then 1 per 10,000m2 unless material or anvil conditions change
Inspection / Test method - Draft NZTA T/24 (Aug-2024)
Acceptance Criteria - To establish suitability of rollers and compaction mode / pattern to achieve FBS-MDD
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Field PDT sheet photos into ConQA for ER and Pavement designer to assess.
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - If FBS-MDD can't be achieved then the PDT-MDD must be approved by the ER
Detail of Activity / Test - Maximum Dry Density
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - On the first day on a new treatment section, then 1 per 10,000m2 unless the material changes
Acceptance Criteria - For analysis of DoC
○ To be done at the sampled MC, at hand squeze test MC and 1% above the hand squueze test on site
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - MDD briqutte to be produced on site if travel time to lab > 30 minutes
○ Note that if the Stabilising Contractor notices changes in material then another one point DD at the hand squeeze test moisture content shall be carried out.
Detail of Activity / Test - Degree of Compaction (DoC)
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 5 per 1,000m2
Inspection / Test method - NZS 4407.4.2.1 (DT full stabilising depth)
Acceptance Criteria - Average DoC ≥ 95%, Minimum DoC ≥ 92%
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report
Detail of Activity / Test - Supply, pre-compact and trim to line and level with NZTA M/4 AP40
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Prior to stabilisation per section
Acceptance Criteria - As per NZTA Z/16
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Drawing Showing levels and crossfalls
Responsibility - Stabilising Contractor with Main Contractor
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - This is the last opportunity to check items before adding the FB. Assess items such as (but not limited to):
– any concerns with shape and tie in
Detail of Activity / Test - Plan showing cut lines and sequencing of works
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Prior to each section
Acceptance Criteria - Points covered in NZTA B/5
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Daily Production Plan
